Scott spends the night in the lawn.
Scott ends up in the neighbor's yard
1414.content:
A huge shape blocked the morning sun as the equivalent of a size 89 shoe came crashing down. When the sneakered foot that belonged to the oldest boy came down, the very tip of the toe of the sneaker landed on the engine compartment of the car completely flattening it like aluminum foil under 90,776 tons of weight. As the foot lifted off it kicked the ruined Malibu , the car spun out of control until coming to a stop, about that time the airbag went off.

One he realized he was still alive, Scott looked out the back window, what was left of it, and saw the three potential executioners board the school bus over the grass of the front lawn. The kid didn't even notice. He'd been hurled hundreds of feet into the front lawn and the whole thing had gone unnoticed by the three giants. He considered himself lucky to be alive, if he'd been standing there with no car he'd be a stain by now. Hurting all over, he crawled out of the wreckage of his car.

"And I had just made my last payment." Scott said to no one as he looked at what was left of his car. He wondered if he ever got back how he was going to explain to his insurance company how his car got partially crushed by a teenage boy.

Scott looked at the house. It was walking distance, but he had no idea of he could get inside. His odds for survival were marginally better inside than it was outside. But it would take a while to get there. And once he was there, how would he get in? It wasn't like he could climb the steps and ring the doorbell. He opened the trunk of the car and pulled out his camping equipment. A knapsack, a tent, and a few flares. He had meant to take these out weeks ago. Good thing he hadn't. Otherwise he'd be in more trouble than he was.

With his gear on his back, Scott left his car and started his walk through the alien forest that was the front lawn of the house. Maybe ten minutes later there was a flapping of wings. He looked behind him, then up towards the sky as a crow flew off with his wrecked Malibu in it's claws. It must've been attracted to the silver paint. Good thing he didn't decide to make camp there.

Travel was slow. The terrain was uneven and muddy. And he had to avoid the predatory insects and arachnids that called the lawn home.
1414.title: Flung into the front yard

choices: Nothing happens to Scott
Someone comes out the door
The kids come back from school
14141.content:
Sure it was a long and painful journey ahead (he has to deal with a giant grasshopper, a hungry mantis, and even a monstrous bird), but Scott managed to make it to the house. The building was even bigger than he imagined; if it was in his world, it could house trillions of people inside. He approaches the wall that was the single step of the house and of course, he realized that it would be even harder to reach the top by it than by walking across the path. Despite that, he pressing on since it was only a single wall and he doesn't want to stay outside.

He tried to climb it with his bare hands a few times but unfortunately, it was too slippery to climb. "Oh crap!" Scott said under his breath. He looks around the yard to see if there was some way to get up there and soon he found something that might help him. He spots a tall grass blade that was near the step and it was tall enough to reach the top. He ran towards it after realizing that he could use it like a ladder.

Grabbing the tall plant, he makes his way up to the top. So far, there was nobody around here but he can't just think that nobody is home at the moment. After he made it to the house, he dash to the gigantic door and plans to slip underneath it.

What happens next?
14141.title: Homeward

choices: Walk away as was expected.
Step into the grass and crouch down, as if she was searching for something.
14142.content:
As Scott ventured through the vast landscape of the Anderson lawn, he was beset by yet more tremors in the ground. Sure, they were less unpleasant than when he was on the concrete path, but they still almost knocked the ant-sized young man off of his feet.

He gazed up and up and up as a towering shape passed by. In the world beyond his view it was merely a young girl yet she appeared as this monolithic creature to the insect in the grass. Of course a human was a living tower from the perspective of a bug, but Scott just wasn't used to seeing things from said perspective. Scott had stopped all walking, he was busy observing the titanic kid.

She looked somewhat similar in age to the Anderson girl, long red hair tied up in neat braids. He hadn't seen her face yet, which wasn't surprising. The clothing the girl had on was predominantly brown, a large jacket and shorts that extended down to just above her knees. A bag was in her hand, though Scott couldn't see inside the container.

The young titaness knocked the door, peering up as the door opened to reveal an older woman, much taller than she was (if Scott even thought that possible).
"Hello Miranda," The older giant's voice was loud enough to wash over the whole lawn, and he could tell her tone was warm and friendly.

"Hello Miss Anderson!" The girl, Miranda, chirped in response. Her voice was also loud enough for Scott to hear, "Do you want to buy some cookies?"
He stopped paying attention to the conversation as he continued on his way, slowly but surely meandering his way through the clumpy, wet dirt as the superior lifeforms conversed overhead. It seemed she was just a simple girl scout, not much to worry about.

He looked up as he heard the closing of the door, eyes following Miranda as she began to move again. Double checking could never hurt, right? He just couldn't ignore her movements as tremors began to wrack the ground, eyes going wide as he watched her...
14142.title: Miranda Ellis

choices: Miranda sees him as a tiny person.
Miranda sees another bug for her fun.
141422.content:
Scott tensed up as he watched the young girl scout step into the grass towards him, just about remaining on his feet as the tremors caused by her sandal-clad feet grew stronger. She most certainly wasn't done here.

Seeing Miranda's face was impossible for the bug-sized man, she appeared well over 1500 feet tall to him. Such a number was impossible to visualize in his head, but here it was standing right before him.

His small mental tangent was immediately shattered by the booming noise and tremors created by her immense pale knee slamming into the ground. He was sent flying back along with some small flecks of dirt, landing on his back with a grunt. Gazing up, his eyes met her face, now visible as she peered down at the ground.

Freckles dotted it all over, a small absent smile on her lips as her innocent looking blue eyes scanned over the soil and grass. Said eyes suddenly thinned mischievously as they reached for something, causing Scott to begin uncomfortably shuffling back. She kind of freaked him out, and it wasn't just her size doing it.

------

Miranda looked around to check if anyone was watching before she delicately plucked up the small unfortunate ant she'd discovered. Quickly, she shifted the insect over to her bag, sliding a packet of cookies to the side to reveal a jar. After hastily unscrewing the lid she dropped the bug inside. It didn't take long for her to find more ants, scooping them up and putting them into her containment for the little beings. Sure, a few popped against her fingers when she squeezed too hard, but her supply was ample, What was one or two squished bugs when there were hundreds available in this garden alone?

The 13 year old giantess took another look around, not wanting her interests to be revealed to anyone in the neighborhood. Miranda liked playing with insects, she'd pick them up and take them home and have her way with them in her bedroom. Most of all, however, she'd found herself really enjoying their taste for some reason. It had stemmed from a game of truth or dare with the other girls in the scouts, but after a few more secret 'taste tests' she'd decided that she liked them.

Looking down, her eyes landed on a speck in the dirt. It was moving slowly and it was like no bug she'd ever seen before. Leaning in closer she observed the little thing.

------

Scott's eyes went wide as he watched the titanic girl pick up and store numerous ants and woodlice within her bag, her thin blue eyes eventually landing on his comparatively minuscule body. He bit his lip unsure of whether she knew he was a person or not.
141422.title: The Scout's Secret

choices: They were in her Bedroom
They were in an Attic
They were in a Kitchen
They were just inside the front door
1414221.content:
The hand that descended upon him was the hand of a god. The thumb and forefinger out stretched to grasp him. As futile as it was, Scott's first instinct was to run. A very difficult thing to do considering the terrain. Even if the ground was as flat as a prairie highway it wouldn't have made any difference.

Something big and strong pitched his backpack, and then he was rising upward past the grass. There was a SNAP as the straps on his backpack broke but his fall was short, he landed with a cushioned bounce into the palm of the young giantess' other hand.

'That was close.' Miranda thought. She had almost lost her prize.

She looked at the object she held between her fingers. A backpack. What was left of one. She had inadvertently crushed it. Deciding that the items inside were probably pulverized beyond repair, she reluctantly gave it a flick. Then she drew her attention down to the little man in her hand. It was indeed a little man. She had no trouble telling the difference between the man and the bugs she collected. About a half inch tall, she guessed. Maybe less.

Where did he come from? Where there any more?

Miranda decided she had collected enough bugs for today. She stood up, hearing an an almost inaudible yelp from the man she held. Very slowly, so she wouldn't startle him further, she closed her hand into a fist. then she lowered her hand to her side and headed for home.

As for Scott, he was scared as naturally anyone would in an impossible situation like this. Of course his goal was to make contact and yes he had wanted help. He also wanted the time to get used to approaching these giants and judging their personalities so he wouldn't be in more trouble than he was. All of that had gone out the window.

This young Giantess didn't seem to have hostile intentions for him, she could've easily crushed him. She still could. But that look she had on her face when she held up that ant...Scott wasn't very good at reading faces, but there was something about it that made him feel uneasy.

It was dark in the closed hand with the exception of some cracks of light from between the fingers. He knew she was on the move, but he had no idea where. A part of his brain was telling him to bite the pale flesh that surrounded him so the young giantess would open her hand and he'd be able to get way. He concluded that part of his brain was an idiot.

Bite her? And risk falling to his death? Or being crushed into pulp by a giant angry adolescent? Not happening.

He suddenly felt her come to a stop. The hand move upward and it leveled in a horizontal position. This was it. Where ever this young Giantess had taken him, it looked as though they had arrived. The fingers unclenched, Scott breathed in fresh air. He was blinded at first, but after blinking a few times his eyes adjusted to the light. He looked about.
1414221.title: Miranda's  tiny person.

choices: Follow Scott and his bug filled jar prison.
Follow Miranda as she sells more cookies on her way home.
1414222.content:
Miranda unknowingly met the gaze of the tiny speck before her, looking over him for a moment before she deemed the speck to just be a regular old bug. Sure it was an odd one, but it was still a bug. With a sigh she pinched it up between her fingers and began to move the 'bug' over to her jar.

------

Scott looked up at her with wide eyes, freezing up in the moment of the enormous being staring down at him. Had she seen him? Had she not? His question seemed to be answered as the enormous hand drew near. He went cold as the large fingers pushed against either side. Any more pressure and he felt like he'd explode.

The ground rapidly pulled away from him, the large fingers quickly lifting him up. He looked around frantically, eyes passing over Miranda's face a few times (her expression was largely uncaring) before he looked down.

Big mistake. Below him was her large bag, filled almost entirely with packets of what he assumed were cookies. Much more alarming was the jar directly below him, crawling with bugs that rivaled him in size. He fruitlessly tried to squirm in her firm grip, eyes wide as she lowered him into the container.

------

Miranda lowered the speck to the rim of the jar, before dropping him in. She just managed to screw on the lid (complete with air holes), before a voice pulled her out of her task.

"Miranda? What are you doing?" It was the mother of the house, the one she'd just sold cookies to.

"I'm sorry Miss Anderson," She stood, pushing a packet over her jar. A smile crossed her face, "I tripped and dropped all my cookies, I'm such a klutz,"

Looking back at her, the girl scout was happy to see her nod and return to her home, she'd gotten off free with her little toys. The young girl skipped away from the house without a care in the world.
1414222.title: A Strange Bug

choices: Miranda picks up a bug
Miranda picks up a "Bug" AKA Scott
14142221.content:
You're about the size of the common housefly. You find yourself in a jar with bugs the size of you and bigger. Question= How do you survive? Answer= by any means necessary.

This of course was the situation Scott found himself in. The constant bouncing about from the young giantess skipping from door to door was keeping the Predatory insects at bay. The others, the none predatory, were more concerned in their own survival and ignored him except for the odd time he found himself upon one like a bucking bronco. That were at least Two things that played in his favor.

It was the moments were things were still. When the young Giantess would be at the front door of a house selling cookies. That's when things got violent and it was every man/bug for himself. That's when he found himself crawling away from a bug or being crawled over by a bug.

Something tugged on his backpack. An ant had managed to get a hold of it with it's mandibles. As he was lifted, Scott wiggled free of the backpack along with his survival gear. That was of no concern for him, let the ant take it if it wanted it so badly!

This went on for who knew how long. Moments of being bumped about followed by moments of fighting for his life. One thing was becoming increasingly clear. The bugs had a longer stamina than he did. In all honesty he didn't know how much longer he would be able to keep it up.

What was she trying to do, win the trip to Washington?

It wasn't until the hand reached in and closed around the Jar did Scott know the young giantess had made her way back home. She held it up and looked at it's squirming contents. Between getting run over and trying to avoid a pred, Scott looked up at the face peering though the glass. She was chewing on her lower lip as though she was trying to make a choice. A choice about what?

Finally she unscrewed the top of the Jar and reached in.
14142221.title: Every "Bug" for himself!

choices: The Mother (She's doing some gardening).
Billy (he's setting up the sprinklers)
Shelly (She's walking around to the back of the house)
Austin (he's walking around to the back of the house, and he has a friend)
14144.content:
By noon it had become clear to Scott that he wasn't going to make it to the house. Traversing across the lawn was taking longer than he expected. If he hadn't had to worry about predators he might have made better progress. At least the ants ignored him. By two in the afternoon he'd decided it was better to set up camp and move on the next day. He wouldn't be just setting up the tent, that wouldn't do at all. He needed protection.

Scott chose a spot to pitch the tent. A flat stone which wouldn't be comfortable, but at least he wouldn't have to worry about anything crawling up from underneath. He Hoped not anyway. Once that was done, he fortified by collecting whatever he could find and building up around it. Stones, bits of leaves, insect parts, whatever he could find. He heard the Bus, looking past the grass he could see the three children he encountered earlier walking back up the walkway to the house. Even from where he stood, Scott could feel the foot falls vibrating through the ground. He mused that if they were aware of him they might help him. Then again the expectation might clash with reality. The reality was, as they thundered past him to the front door of the house,that he would not be finding out any time soon.

He didn't see them for the rest of that day. By the time the sun was starting to set Scott was secure inside his make shift shelter. He had placed debris in front of the entrance and zipped up his tent. Even with the bedding he had placed in the tent and the sleeping bag on top of that, he doubted he would get much sleep. He just hoped his camp would be look unappealing to a night time predator.

As it grew dark Scott could hear voices from within the house. The voices of the kids and the mother, but no father it seemed. Either he was away, or she was divorced or widowed. They were probably having a hot meal while he lay in his sleeping bag eating a protein bar.

As he had predicted, Scott didn't sleep very well. The night time noises were almost as loud as the daytime. Once he though he heard something crawling up along the side of his shelter. His imagination immediately brought up the vision of a huge centipede. A scary thing to think about.

eventually though Scott did managed to sleep. He was awaken the next morning to the ground shaking and the sound of footsteps. At first he thought maybe it was just someone walking up the walkway, but then he heard the crunching of grass underfoot. Scott sprung out of the tent not caring about predators. Predators could be crushed underfoot just as easily as he could. He looked about and then his eyes focused on
14144.title: Scott spends the night in the lawn.

choices: Jazmine introduces herself
Scott makes the introduction first by stepping out of the car
The phone suddenly rings
Someone is at the Door (Her Mother)
Someone is at the Door (Her younger sister)
142.content:
Jazmine pushed the stroller than contained her six month old child. It was a warm Saturday morning and she had decided to take her child out for a stroll and , as a bonus, get some exercise in. It hadn't been easy for her since the baby had been born. The child's dead beat father had skipped down the day he found out she was pregnant and working while trying to be a good mother to her child was a balancing act. Fortunately she had help from her mother and younger siblings.

Despite her experience with her child's father. Jazmine longed for companionship, and sometimes wished for a man in her life. She was just thinking this when she noticed a flash of silver in the sidewalk ahead of her. She frowned. It was moving. She could here a buzzing noise from it as if it were motorized. She picked up the pace, easily overtaking it. As she got closer she was surprised to see that it was a car about the size of a hotwheels. Acting quickly she reached down and picked it up off the sidewalk. The front wheels spun for a brief moment before coming to a stop. Between her thumb and fingers it felt fragile and not like a toy at all. There was a wisp of smoke coming from the tail section.

When Jazmine gazed into the interior of the car she almost dropped the car in surprise.

Scott looked into the dark eyes of the ebony face of the woman who had picked up his car and was holding it between her fingers. There was no callous in her expression, only shock. She brought the car closer so that all he could see was a single eye. The eye focused on him. It blinked twice. With no other option available he waved at her. The eye widened. He heard the woman whisper one two words.

"A man."

Suddenly he was descending towards the woman's pants. A moment later he was in the tight confines of her front pocket. He shut the engine off. He could tell the woman had turned direction and was heading back the way she had come. He couldn't tell though if her pace had been faster or not. Scott unbuckled his seat belt and waited. He hoped she wasn't hostile.

Jazmine tried not to be hurried as she made her way back to the house she had been renting. To anyone who happened to see or meet up with her she would just say she had to go really bad. Taking her baby out of the carriage she stepped into the house and when directly to her bedroom. With her heart pounding into her chest she carefully removed the car from her pocket. She held it in her palm while her baby cooed and made noises.
142.title: The Young Mother.

choices: The car gets caught on a shoelace. Scott is coming along for the jog!
One of the joggers kicks the car. Flying through the air, Scott lands at a cafe.
Suddenly, the joggers stop. They have noticed the tiny car!
143.content:
The rumbling swelled to a rhythmic booming noise. Then, it felt as if the entire earth was shaking!

Boom, Boom...

Boom, Boom...

Something was getting close. Something incredibly large...

Boom, Boom...

Dread filled Scott, as a realization hit him. That giant house could only mean one thing! That there were giant people around.

Boom, Boom...

And then, he finally noticed them.
Around a corner, two gargantuan woman appeared. Both were clad in workout clothes. One, a brunette woman, her hair bound into a ponytail, wore a grey tank top and tight fitting leggings. The other one, slightly smaller, had opted for an outfit that was more appropriate for the summer like temperature, a blue crop top with matching shorts. Both of them wore spotless white sneakers.
But more importantly: the were running directly towards Scott!

Panic filled him, and Scott jumped back into his car, sparking the ignition. With a low whine, the engine came to life. Scott didn't hesitate to press the gas pedal all the way down.
The wheels squealed as spun in place and Scott was driving away from the colossal joggers. The speedometer ticked upwards. 40 miles per hour. 50 miles per hour. 60. 100. 120...

He hit the maximum speed his car was capable of. But, as he looked into the rear view mirror, a shiver ran down Scott's spine.
The joggers were only coming closer. Even at top speed, his car couldn't hope to escape the two titans. Their feet thundered down relentlessly, each stomp closer to him than before.
Scott was paralyzed. He had to try something, anything... or else, he would be crushed underneath those sneakers.

Gripping the wheel with both hands, he took a deep breath. Then, Scott pressed down on the gas, pushing the pedal all the way through as he swerved right in a desperate attempt to escape.
143.title: Escape from the colossal joggers

choices: Find a way inside the house.
Stay right where he was.
Move the car to higher ground.
145.content:
The rumbled intensified and then...faded away.

Well, that was anticlimactic.

Scott put the car in gear and headed straight for the front steps of the house. It was an older house, but that didn't mean it would be easy to get in. That wasn't his number one priority anyway. It wasn't until he had pulled off and parked under the heavy leaves of a rose bush did he feel he was safe. Well, relatively safe anyway. At least he was out of site of giants, and the Malibu should protect him from predatory insects. Yeah, like a shark cage protects the diver from a great white shark.

So, now what?

Never mind the fact that everything was gigantic, never mind the fact that this was all a slap in the face of everything that was taught to him about that being laughably impossible. If only there was a way to find out more about this world.

Hold on, maybe there was. He opened up his backpack and took out his laptop. As soon as it was up and running he began to search for wi fi signals. Much to his surprise he found them, the majority were strong but required a password. All but one. There's always someone who doesn't keep his or her wireless password protected. What did he find out? Not much at first , his own web browser was almost incompatible to what passed for an internet browser. When he did finally manage to gain access to the information highway, the majority of popular sites he knew simply didn't exist. He wasn't sure if that was good or bad.

Despite the setbacks, he did manage to learn what he needed. He learned where he was, the year, the weather and what was happening in this world. As far as politics and worldly affairs go, it was a calmer place than the one he'd left. He was glad for that. Maybe these giants had more sense than to screw up the world.

With a sigh, he closed his laptop and put it away. He looked out at the vast jungle that was the front yard.

"and I resolved that as man had dominated the world of the sun, so I would dominate my world."

There were preparations to make. The forecast he learned bothered him. It called for a lot of rain, maybe thunder showers. Sure, he was probably protected under the leaves of the rose bush but he wasn't sure if he had the high ground. The last thing he wanted was to drown in his car. He looked about. He could drive the car further up the incline, but the leaves were not as thick there. He wasn't sure if his car would take the pounding of giant raindrops. Certainly not the glass. Maybe he could cover the whole car with a leaf.

His other option was more frighting. He could find a way into the house. If insects and spiders can find their way into a house, why not him? Than again, who knows who or what he'll find inside.

He thought for a moment, then made his decision.
145.title: It was nothing

choices: ...digging his way to the house
...climbing up to the window
...approaching the front door
1451.content:
"Well I guess it's alot better than staying in a dangerous spot like this..." sighed Scott as he looked at the building behind him, it was of course really huge. So far, he haven't seen any giants from the house so he isn't sure how many of them are dangerous to be around with. With his tiny, almost-flea size body, it's unlikely if any of them will notice him (unless if there's any possibility of doing so).

Scott looked at the ground and thought: "Maybe I could dig my way into the house from underground." The big question is how to get there. Even if he had a shovel with him, it'll probably take him forever to dig due to the size of the earth.

Scott looked high up to see a large window just above his exact location. "I could enter inside the house from that window." he said. However by the looks of it, it look like it would also take hours to get up there, it'll probably even exhaust him afterwords.

Finally, the last possible option is even more risky than the two: climb the stairs and go inside from under the front door. Since it doesn't involve physicality other than running towards it, it would be quicker to get inside. The big risk however is that Scott have no idea if there's any giants inside. If they were, they'll might exit the house and unknowingly step on him if he's not careful.

After making his choice, he exit his car and look at it. He definitely isn't going to bring it along so he probably just going hide it somewhere so it won't get soak by the raindrops.

His path will be...
1451.title: Find a way inside the house.

choices: A 10 year old boy (Named Brian)
A Teenage Girl picking out toys (babysitter)
An Adult Woman placing more toys in the box (Mother)
An Adult Woman taking toys out of the box (Mother)
Nothing, Someone has shut the curtains.
15.content:
Scott closed his eyes, and opened them again. But the sight before him remained.

Surrounding him, piled all around him were Enormous toys. A hotwheels dinky car was the same size as his own Malibu. Stuffed animals and Action Figures towered above him like discarded monuments. Looking upwards to a ceiling thousands of feet above his head Scott could see that he was in a wooden Toy Box.

A thousand questions raced through his mind as he tried to think of a rational explanation. His heart pounded in his chest and he did everything he could to force down the growing fear inside of him. That is until he heard a child's voice echoing in the distance. He felt the first tremors a moment later, and they grew steadily stronger. Scott climbed into the car, and locked the doors. He knew it was a futile gesture, but better to have some sense of protection than none at all. The Car bounced on it's shocks as the tremors grew stronger and stronger. A Dark shadow fell over him and Scott gazed up through the wind shield at--
15.title: Among Children's Toys

choices: He had spotted his Dad inside
He starts playing with his new toy
He puts his new toy in his pocket
151.content:
The Car bounced on it's shocks as the tremors grew stronger and stronger. A Dark shadow fell over him and Scott gazed up through the wind shield at a 10 year old boy staring about his toy box. However this shocked Scott on a number of things. The first thing, was the boy was actually his son, named Brain.

Brain had blonde hair with no freckles, he had a cute look to his face and was also slim looking build, and was always had a smile to his face as far as these toys and things go. However, the second thing Scott was more worried about it and the answer was simple. He was shrunk, and so does the car he drove. That caused a lighting to strike which made him smaller like a toy amongst the rest.

That feared Scott for his sake and see his son's huge hands reaching out and takes it out to have a look at it. Scott's wasn't sure if this was what he feared the worst and had to put on a seat belt for good measure.

"Hmmm... I never seen that car before, but it certainly looks real." A huge echoed voice from Brain as he inspect the car with Scott having a close view towards his face while sitting at the front seat. Brain had an eye out view when...
151.title: Scott had found an answer

choices: Examine the tiny man
Pick the tiny man up between his fingers
Pin the tiny man to his palm
Play with the tiny man
1511.content:
Scott saw Brian's huge blue eye suddenly focus on him, a second later it grew wide.

"COOL!"

"Gah!" Scott covered his Ears "Brian, Don't shout!"

Brian held the car out from his body, far enough away for Scott to see most of his face. The face had a look of concentration, as if the 10 year old was trying to figure something out. Scott was so focused on the boy's face that he was startled when the nail of the boy's index finger crashed through the windshield and hooked itself under the roof of the car. Then , much to his astonishment, The side doors of the Malibu crushed inward as the fingers holding it held it tighter as Brian began to peel back the roof of the car the way you'd peel back the top of a pudding cup. It didn't matter to the 10 year old what was happening to the car.

It was what was inside that interested him.

When enough of the roof was peeled back, Scott found himself tumbling into an awaiting palm as the car was turned upside down. Debris and items that had been in the back seat of the car rained down around him as he struggled to get his bearings. Getting up on his elbows he looked up at the face of his son, he was about to scold the boy when he noticed something. The way he looked at him it was almost as though....

Brian didn't recognize him.

'Oh no' he thought as he watched his son smile.

What will Brian do?
1511.title: Not Recognized

choices: Reader's Choice
Reader's Choice
Reader's Choice
1512.content:
Brian's eyes scanned the box of toys until they stopped on a small matchbox car.

"Hmm?" The boy made a perplexed face as he reached down towards the unfamiliar toy.

"Oh God.." Scott's heart began to race as one of his son's hands began reaching towards him. The fleshy open palm shrouded the car in darkness as it descended. Scott came to the full realization of just how small he was as the boy's massive fingers pressed up against both side of the car. There was a sudden jolt as the car began to ascend into the air. As the boy brought the matchbox car up to his face, he flipped it upside down to see if there were any manufacturer details on the bottom.

“Hmm... that's weird.. there's nothing written under here...” Brian hummed with confusion as he inspected the very detailed looking underside of the car.

Scott felt his stomach drop as the car suddenly flipped upside down. The man was now quite happy that he put his seatbelt on only a few moments before, as it was the only reason he hadn't just been thrown into the ceiling.

Not finding anything, Brian released his pinch on the car and let it roll on it's side down the length of his fingers and into his palm.

Poor Scott was sent into a nauseous spin as the car suddenly rolled on it's side twice before finally settling on it's wheels with a heavy thump.

“uuughhh...” Scott dizzily looked out the window, realizing that the car was now literally in his son's hand. He watched the world beyond the giant hand slowly turn left and right as the boy inspected the car from every angle.


As he sat there recovering from his recent roller coaster , Scott realized this would probably be his best opportunity to safely get the boy's attention.

Taking a deep breath and collecting courage, Scott reached for the handle.

…...
…??


Gripping onto the handle, the anxious man was startled to find that the door wouldn't budge.

“Damn it!” Scott swore as he realized the door might have been slightly dented in when the Brian's fingers pressed on it.

Just as Scott was about to try the other side, he realized that Brian's enormous god-like face was now directly in front of the windshield.

Bringing the car closer to his face, the boy attempted to stare into the windows.

“BRIAN!! IN HERE! IT'S ME DAD!!!” Scott waved desperately at the boy whose giant analytical eyes seemed to show no sign of surprise, only curiosity.

Brian was unable to see behind the windows due to a glare; not that it really mattered to the ten year, as he never actually cared about the inside of his toy cars.
1512.title: He starts playing with his new toy

choices: Eh it's junk (crush it)
Brian thinks of something fun to do with it
15121.content:
The boy hummed with a disappointed tone as he gives the car one last look around.

As far as the boy could tell, the car didn't have a brand. The only thing interesting about it was the detail, but whatever it was made with seemed pretty flimsy.

It was then that Brian noticed that the doors on both sides had been dented in.

"Wow, that's petty lame" The boy stared at the car with shifty unimpressed eyes.

Curious to see if the rest of the car was just as bad, the boy pressed his index finger on it's roof, causing it to buckle slightly.

"Yeah.. probably just some knockoff toy from a fleamarket " The boy muttered coldly under his breath before letting the car roll into his palm again.

Brian decides..
15121.title: Brian decides it's Junk

151211.content:
Scott continued to look out beyond the windshield at the boy as he began to press on the car's roof. Something about his son's unhappy expression made the man feel uneasy.

Having heard the boy's other comments about the car being 'lame' and a 'knock off' was sort of offensive, but the real red flag rose when he heard.

"Pfft, What a piece of junk.." The boy's expression clearly conveyed disgust.

"B-Brian?" The worried father began to mutter just the boy's fingers suddenly closed in around the car.

For a moment Scott was worried that the boy was planning on tossing him back into the toy chest, but he quickly realized Brian had a different idea.

The car around the tiny man began to creak loudly, much louder than the soft groans from before.

Every side of the car began to buckle inwards.

"HEY!! BRIAN BE CAREFUL! YOU'RE DAMAGING M-...." Scott's heart sank as he realized what the boy was more than aware of the damage he was causing.

The ten year old tightened his grip on the small car, causing it to compress.

Scott began to scream as all the windows exploded inwards.

"BRIAN NOOOO!!! STOP!!" The frantic terrified father could do nothing but watch as the giant fleshy fingers tightened around the car's structure until he felt himself being painfully pressed in from every side.

Brian grunted softly as he clenched his fist as hard as he could. He could feel the crumby tin-strength metal compress between his fingers as he squeezed the car into an ball. It was almost kind of amusing to the boy how easy it was to crush.

Giving it one final squeeze, Brian tightened his fist to the point that compressing it any further seemed impossible.

Upon opening his hand, the only thing left was an ugly unrecognizable ball of scrap

"Haaaah, I knew it. Just a cheap knock off" The boy muttered boastfully as he tossed the scrap into the waste bin next to his door.

He would never notice the odd red substance leaking from the ball as it rested at the bottom of the empty garbage bag.
151211.title: Eh it's junk (crush it)

15122.content:
"Hmm, I wonder if it goes fast.." Brian questioned as he took a seat on the floor of his room

Firmly holding both sides the tiny matchbox car, the boy placed the toy onto the hardwood floor.

"Oh god, what is he...." Scott wasn't even able to finish the thought before the boy revved the car backwards with a terrifyingly quick tug.

Poor Scott slammed into the steering wheel a painful honk.

Expecting the car to have zoomed forward upon letting it go, Brian seemed pretty disappointed.

"What the heck...? Maybe the rubberband broke??" The boy muttered with disappointment as he tugged the car forwards and backwards repeatedly, causing his father to slam back and forth continuously.

The one thing the boy noticed each time he rev'd was a 'mysterious' honk, which was really the result of poor Scott face-planting with the horn. After about the seventh honk, the horn seemed to stop working all together.

"-Sigh- I guess it's just broken... maybe I should throw it out..." Brian muttered as he looked down at the car.

"Oh crap..." Though he was still dizzy, the last thing Scott wanted was for his car to be thrown into the trash, especially with him still inside!

Thinking quickly, Scott turned the keys and hit the gas.

Brian suddenly gasped as the car between his fingers lunged forward without his assistance.

"Woooah, cool" The amazed ten year old watched as the car started making right and left turns all on it's own.

As Scott drove around the massive floor of his son's bedroom, he began to think of ways he could communicate with him.

"Dammit, he still has no idea it's me...If only I could just spell it out for h-..... Oh wait!"

Scott suddenly realized he could literally spell out a message with his driving.

Coming to a complete stop, Scott suddenly began driving in very straight, precise directions. repeatedly.

"That's weird.... what's it doing...." Brian squatted down in front of the tiny car as it continued driving in the same pattern over and over again.

"Waaaaaait a sec.....*GASP*" The boy's eyes went wide as he realized it was spelling out his name "BRIAN"

"OH MY GOSH!! THAT'S SOOO COOOL!!!"

Judging by the boy's reaction, Scott knew he had succeeded. All he had to do now was keep the boy's attention long enough to write out a sentence like "I'm inside the car"

Before he could attempt it, the excited ten year old jumped to his feet and ran over to the doorway.

"ANDREW!! HURRY!! LOOK AT WHAT MY NEW TOY CAN DO!!!" The boy screamed down the hallway towards his older brother's room.

Scott felt a wave of relief knowing that Brian was getting his older son involved, making it much more likely he'd get some actual help.

A groan could be heard down the hall from the bedroom adjacent to the boys.

"Uugh, what do you want Brian?" An annoyed adolescent voice poured from the doorway.

Andrew was 16 years old currently going through his rebellious stage. Regardless of the teasing and tormenting the teen usually put the younger boy through, Brian was always making an effort to impress his sibling idol.

"Pleeeeeaase! It's really cool I promise!" Brian whined until the older brother eventually appeared in his doorway.

The highschool freshman was wearing a yellow illustrated tee shirt, pair of black jeans, and a pair of his frayed year-old sneakers.

"This seriously better be good.." The aggravated teen stood in the doorway as the younger male sat down on the floor by the car.

"Look! This car can spell out my name all by itself!!" Brian beamed, excited to impress his older sibling.

Scott stared out the window at the giant teen who towered even higher than Brian by a foot and a half. The boy's boxers were partially showing and he seemed to be in a grumpier mood than when he last saw him.

The teen rolled his eyes .

"That's what you called me in here for? Some lame toy?" The teen snapped at the boy. It started to seem very likely to Scott that the older boy's bad mood was due to some sort of teenage drama at school.

"W-wait! Just look! I'm telling you it's cool!" Brian begged as he nudged the car, waiting for it to zoom off like it did before.

Knowing that Andrew probably wouldn't wait much longer, Scott put the car into gear and began to drive.....

...
..
After a moment of acceleration, the car suddenly puttered to a complete stop.

???

"No......GOD DAMMIT!" Scott's heart sank as he realized the gas tank had just ran out of juice. The frustrated father slammed his fists on the steering wheel. “I was so close!”

"Nooo~.. why isn't it doing it?!" Brian whined as he began to pull and tug at the car.

“Wow, I should have known you'd just waste my time like usual...All your toys are total junk huh?” Unfortunately for Brian, the older teen was clearly just looking for any excuse to bully the boy at this point, as doing so had recently become the teen's primary form of venting .

"I'm telling you it worked before!!!" The boy gave the car a rough push, causing it to roll across the room in front of the taunting teen.

"Really? So now you're wasted my time with stupid make-believe lies...You really are just a lame little kid" The teen glanced down at the tiny car between his sneakers and instinctive knew his next course of action.

“Well, I guess since it's broken, you won't be needing it anymore...” The cruel sixteen year old smirked as he began lifting his foot over the tiny matchbox car.

Scott felt a wave of fear wash over him as he watched one of his son's massive worn sneakers lift off the ground and cast a vast shadow over his car. The dirty sole of the teen's sneaker was patterned with worn repeating treads that practically had no grip to them anymore. The dizzying patterns blurred by before the foot came to a dead stop directly over the vehicle.

"WAIT!! ANDREW PLEASE!!! NOOOO!!" Brian started to plead frantically as he realized what his brother intended to do.

"Say goodbye to your stupid little toy~" The teen grinned began to slowly lower his foot.

The teen's word's sent Scott into a panicked frenzy.

"NO NO!!! ANDREW STOP!!! PLEASE!! ANDREW I'M IN HERE!! IT'S DAD!!!! NOOOO!!"

The sound of creaking turned to crunching and shattering as the vast, heavy sole of the sneaker made contact with the top of the roof.

The teen seemed to be taking a lot of enjoyment out of both the boy's reaction and the crunching sound under his foot as he pressed down harder

As the sneaker and the floor came closer together, the light between the two dimmed. Scott had dove down onto the floor of the car with some futile hope that the teenager would only partially crush the car and leave. The horrified father could only imagine the enormous bare foot of his older son just beyond the sneaker pressing down mercilessly from above with no sign of stopping. This was one of the same feet the loving father used to playfully tickle back when Andrew was just a happy little kid; now it was the harbinger of his doom.

Sadly for the unfortunate father, Andrew's enjoyment came first, and he clearly wasn't going to settle until he had crushed the stupid toy completely flat.

The crackling and popping noise of the car's compression eventually came to an abrupt end as the bottom of the teen's sneaker made total contact with the floor. The car had essentially disappeared between the two. The satisfied teen licked his lips as he slowly twisted his heel back and forth.

Just as he was about to turn and leave, the teen decided to taunt the sobbing boy one last time.


"Heh, just wait till I tell dad you were lying..!~" The sixteen year old smirked as he walked out, finally lifting his size seven foot off the flattened clump of foil

heading out to a friend's house

1513.content:
Scott looked into the blue eyes of his son, taking note of the dimples he'd inherited from his mother and the long blond hair in the style popular with kids his age . The oils excreted from he pores of the boy's fingers and palm caused the windshield to appear opaque, thus preventing the child to get a good look at the interior of the car.Not that Brain payed attention to such things. Scott could hear metal protest as the boy grasped the car between his fingers. Who would've guessed a 10 year old boy could have that kind of power. It frighten and fascinated Scott all at the same time.

Scott considered blowing the horn of the Malibu in an attempt to get his son's attention but before he could do such a thing Brian's smiling face fell away and he found himself slipped into the darkened pocket of the boy's jean pants. It had been a rather violent motion and had he not been wearing his seat belt he probably would've crashed face first into the windshield. A moment later he was slammed back and forth from the movement of the huge leg he was against. Brian was on the move, but where?

Scott tried to recall layout of his house and based upon the movement and direction he sensed for certain he and his son were heading down stairs. Where exactly was another story. That he had no clue.

With her turned up nose and big framed glasses one could've mistaken her for a member of the Scoobie Do gang. Brushing a lock of brown hair from her face, she gazed down into toy chest. What her intentions were, Scott had no idea. Then--

153.content:
Scott can't help but scream as the visage of a mountainous woman fills his field of vision. She looks to be about 30, pretty, with short blonde hair. But he barely registers this, as she drops something massive into the box.

Scott covers his head in fear as an enormous stuffed pig lands on top of him, blocking his field of vision. The rumbles slowly subside, and he begins to breathe again.

The pig didn't even reach him; it's suspended about fifteen feet up on some other toys. Still, he can see it's perched precariously, and could fall at any moment. He looks up; he can't stay here. If he stays in the box, he's bound to be crushed by some toy. He has to get out, but how?

1531.content:
With his options limited, Scott decided his only course of action was to climb out. But first things first. Opening the trunk of the car, he removed what he felt he would need and what he could readily carry. Unpacking his back pack he loaded it up with his first aid kit and road flares. He had a few bottles of water and some granola bars. Not much but it would do for now. He looked up, deciding that the best way to get up to the top would be to climb the teddy bear as it was the only thing that was really sticking out of the box. Course climbing down the other side was a different story but he'd deal with that later.

"Okay, I can do this."

He started his Assent. Not as easy has he had planned. Though the material was fuzzy and easy to get a hold of, there were points in the climb were it had become too steep to climb and had to take a different route. All the while his thoughts were one the woman he just saw. How big was she? Hundreds of feet tall for sure. He was right there and she hadn't even seen him. What's worst, if she was that big how big was the child whose teddy he was climbing? He really didn't want to meet up with him or her. Children usually become very scared when it comes to tiny living things and they tend to stomp first and ask questions later. His best bet was to find the woman again, she wouldn't be hard to find.

A vibration shook him out of his train of thought. Followed by another, stronger than the last. And another, and another, each growing stronger than the last. He heard someone enter the room and head for the toy box, he'd hoped to see the woman again. Instead a Not so little Girl came into view. There was enough of a resemblance to know this was the woman's daughter. Without hesitation she reached in and picked up the bear.

15311.content:
Scott holds on for dear life as the titanic girl grabs the bear and picks it up as if it was nothing. He's not even sure how old she is -- all he knows is that he's rocketing up toward a mass of fabric, and now he's suddenly colliding with it.

The bear springs back just a bit, and Scott loses his grip. Throwing his hands out, he grasps at anything he can get his hands on; mercifully, he manages to grab on to the pink canopy that fills his vision. He clings tightly to it as the giant girl walks to wherever she's going.

He continues to cling, staring up at her; she isn't a toddler, and she isn't a teen, but beyond that he's not sure how old she is. It occurs to him that she could be going almost anywhere. He doesn't know where he is or what time it is; the light seems a bit dim but that could just be his imagination. All he knows is that he and the bear are going wherever the girl takes them.

The girl knows, of course. She's heading....

Make your way off the bed
153111.content:
11 year old Karen walked over to her toy box and took out her favorite stuffed toy. The bear had been hers since she was a toddler and though normally she didn't sleep with a stuffed animal, she'd seen a flash of lightning. She feared lightning and felt the need to have something with her for comfort. Turning out the lights she climbed into bed, laid down on her back and pulled the covers over herself up to her neck. And she waited for the coming storm.

For Scott, the experience of being under the covers was a disorienting experience. His world had become dark, hot and filled with the sound of the beating of a hard and the bellowing of lungs. This must be what a Bed Bug feels like. Fumbling in the dark he found his Flashlight and looked about. Above him was a ceiling of fabric. Under him was flesh and blood covered in pink material that rose and fell with every breath the child took. He'd only been under the covers a few moment so he knew she was still awake. There was a rumble in the distance. He knew that sound too, the sound of thunder.

'Now what do I do?' he thought, surveying the situation.

As scared as he was, he had to admit the thought the idea of being on a Giant not so little girl was fascinating. How many could say they've done that in their lives? If this had been the mother he'd do some exploring but he had to remind himself that this was a Kid. Course, he didn't see the harm in taking a walk, so long as he stayed clear of the areas that were clearly out of bounds. He heard another thunderclap. He would have to be careful, this kid wasn't going to be asleep any time soon. He could take his time and be very careful. He'd have to keep close attention to the breathing, if it slowed he'd have to leave right away before she rolled over on top of him.

So which way to go.
153111.title: Under The Covers.

choices: itching the spot that tickled.
rolling over onto her side
Sat up in bed
Climbed out of bed.(getting a drink of water)
Pulled the covers back
1531111.content:
Scott swallowed hard; he knew it was rather remarkable, walking on another human, so small she didn't even know he was there. But as he began to walk, he realized that there was a very good reason to go to her head; maybe, just maybe, he could get her attention. No, he didn't figure a kid was the best person to talk to, but he didn't have enough luck to end up on the girl's mother's chest. He had to make do with what fate had dealt him.

He walked up to the edge of her pajama top, startled to see the sudden expanse of skin in front of him. In the dim light he could see her chin, a long way off; her hair was long and was spread out across the pillow.

Throwing caution to the wind, he stepped off of the fabric and onto her chest. It was an amazing feeling, walking on a living thing, feeling her heartbeat with every step.

Unfortunately for Scott, he had forgotten that Karen was still awake. And while she wasn't consciously aware of the tiny man walking across her chest, somewhere in her drowsy state she registered the movement. She reacted lackadaisically....
1531111.title: Head Off Your Problems

choices: Karen thinks Scott is a peice of lint and plays with him.
Karen takes a look at what she's found
Karen loses interest and Lets him go
Scott slips out of her grip
15311111.content:
The sound of something moving behind him caught his attention. He spun around and the flash light beam fell on a huge pudgy hand, the fingers outstretched . He cried out and leaped away as the thick fingers began to scratch the spot where he'd been standing. He'd thought it would go away as soon as the itch had been scratched but it didn't. It began to move toward him.

If he'd kept a level head he might've gotten away without being detected, but he panicked. He took off running, a big mistake as it caused further irritation and the hand followed him, faster than he could run. The fingers were upon him, pressing him down into the flesh of the bare chest. Scott felt the dermal swirls of the girl's index finger against his cheek.

"Hmmmm?"

The Hand paused for a moment, then he was grasped between the fingers and thumb in a grip that made it hard to breath, as though it wasn't already hard to breath. What was she going to do to him?
15311111.title: The Hand

choices: Karen Gets bored and releases the "Lint"
Karen decides to roll the "Lint" into a Ball
153111111.content:
Karen felt the object that had tickled her chest. It felt funny but rather than investigating, she began to absentmindedly roll the object between her fingers. It was probably a piece of lint anyway and it was a good distraction from the rumble overhead.


Scott lay pinned between the child fingers almost completely inclosed by the digits. An arm was free but there was little he could do to make this preteen release him. He considered biting but concluded it would only lead to certain death. Maybe when she finally fell asleep she would--

Suddenly he was spinning.

Back and forth between her fingertips. She was playing with him as though he were a piece of lint! Instinctively as he was rolled around he rammed his arms deeply into his pockets so he wouldn't dislocate a shoulder. With a snap, his shoulder straps broke and his backpack fell away. The sweat and oils from the fingertips began to soak into his shirt, his hair. He could only breath in short breaths. Scotty wondered how long this was going to go on?

Karen and Scott listen to the storm.
153111112.content:
Karen had caught something between her fingers. Something that struggled to escape. What was it? A bug? She'd never been afraid of bugs and she never understood why her friend Nichole always freaked out over something so small. When she pulled her hand out from under the covers, she immediately noticed the tiny stream of white light coming from what she was holding. Turning on her lamp she released what she was holding into her palm. It didn't take long for her young brain to realize that she was holding a Tiny Person. She'd read stories about tiny people but she never thought she'd actually meet one. She shut her lamp off so her Mother wouldn't notice it on and come into the room, and rolled onto her stomach.

Scott shown his flashlight beam up into the face that was looking down at him. He was scared, but concluded if she'd wanted to kill him he'd be dead by now. Instead the girl looked down at him with a look of awe and excitement. He supposed he'd do the same at that age if he'd come across a tiny person.

"Hi!" She whispered. "My name is Karen, what's yours?"

Before he could answer there was a flash accompanied by a loud CRACKBOOM He Flinched. Damn, that had been loud.

"Scared of Thunder too, little man?"

Scott looked up at Karen.She looked a little scared herself. "Don't worry, I'll take care of you."
153111112.title: Karen takes a look at what she's found

She was going to go sleep with her parents.
15311113.content:
Scott braced himself feeling something start to move, he couldn't be sure what the little girl was doing. She let him know soon enough as he found the ground under his feet starting to tilt becoming stepper and stepper, she was sitting up! The flea sized man tried to find a way to hold on, tried to find some way to keep from falling down this towering 11 year old girl, but he had nothing to hold onto. The smooth skin of the young girl soon turning into a wall as he started to slide downwards. The once long plain of pink now turning into a towering wall though he'd be taking a very different route then the one he'd taken up. He dropped down the her collar into the dark confines of her pj's. It was dark and hot as he slid down her body the world going by in a blur before finally falling down into the young girl's lap.

The wind was knocked out of him and his side was bruised, but it seemed sliding down her had slowed his fall enough where he hadn't died falling down into some girl's lap.

He slowly got to his feet trying to see why the girl had sat up...
15311113.title: Sat up in bed

15311114.content:
Karen had been feeling a bit thirsty for a while, but she was too scared of the thunder and lightning to leave her bed. However, the storm seemed to have stopped for the time being. Karen got up and grabbed the glass she kept on the nightstand for this exact reason and headed off to the bathroom to fill it.

Scott was completely unprepared for Karen's movements. In the space of a second the landscape of skin began to rise and slope downward at what seemed to Scott an incredible speed. Scott proceeded to go flying like a rocket from the momentum, hitting the bit of bed sheet just behind him. Fortunately the sheet prevented the impact from being fatal, but unfortunately he was then slingshot back toward the giant girl. Scott was moving far too fast to see where he was going or react, but he grabbed blindly and managed to grasp a couple strands of Karen's long golden hair, which now filled his view. As he held the strains of hair in a death grip the simple act of a young girl getting up from her bed made the world's fastest rollercoaster seem to be moving at a snail's pace in comparison and far more disorienting for Scott. Booms far louder than any thunder he had heard where he had come from sounded with each step as the humongous girl walked to the bathroom, despite the carpet under her feet. Scott could do nothing but hang on to the hair desperately as it swung back and forth like a pendulum with Karen's movements.

Karen of course was completely ignorant of this life and death struggle taking place. Karen reached the bathroom sink and filled the glass when she heard her mother's voice yell and whipped her head towards the sound. "Karen sweetie! You doing alright?" she said. "Just getting some water Mommy!" Karen replied. With that, Karen took a quick drink and headed back to her room where she took one more drink as she sat on the bed before putting the glass on the nightstand again and laid down.

Scott's arms began to ache quickly from the swinging and he knew he couldn't hold on much longer. As Karen filled her glass Scott's felt they were nearly about to give out. Scott heard a woman's voice briefly, but with Karen's head whipping around he found he had no reason to care as he finally lost his grip and went flying. Suddenly Scott found himself immersed underwater and tumbling, he wasn't able to hear another word the two said. Scott stopped moving for a split second before the water began to move, throwing him back one way and then forth another as the girl took a short drink of her glass of water.

Scott's lungs began to burn, and he kicked himself upward towards the surface. Karen's face filled Scott's view as he looked up, and looking around at the clear walls around him in a lake the size of a football field it didn't take a genius to realize where he was. I'm in her water glass! Scott thought in horror as the realization dawned on him. The lake made what seemed to him to be massive waves as the girl walked back to her bedroom, Scott was violently thrown around the glass. While it would have been only a couple centimeters at normal size to the tip of the glass it might as well have been Mount Everest for all the difference it made to Scott.

Unable to escape, Scott felt another massive wave as Karen sat down. Scott's already considerable terror rose yet higher as he saw the girl raise the glass to her mouth. Scott swam away from the child's face towards the other side of the glass, but this made little difference as she tilted the glass edge to her mouth and drank. Scott swam in panic fueled desperation away as he rapidly approached the young girl's cavernous maw, Scott hearing Karen swallow a couple times. Just before he would go in, the glass tilted away and Scott found himself treading water once again. Looking up at the girl, he heard a GULP that sounded to Scott as loud as an explosion and saw her neck move as she swallowed. Apparently she had her thirst quenched for now, and with a violent lurch and another few waves Karen placed the glass on the nightstand.

Scott was safe for the moment but he knew it was only a delay of execution. Scott had no way out, the walls of the glass far too smooth for him to attempt to climb out, and there was only so long he could swim. Scott knew his situation was hopeless, either he would be drank by a preteen girl at some point over the course of the night or she would fall asleep and he would eventually lose his strength and drown.

A few minutes later, Karen felt a bit thirsty again and picked up the glass. This time she took a long, slow drink and put it back on the nightstand. Scott saw a massive hand reach over and grab the glass. "PLEASE MISS! PLEASE DON'T! DON'T DRINK ME!!!" Scott screamed as loud as he could as Karen raised the glass edge to her face even though he knew she would never hear him. Once again Scott swam to the opposite side of the glass, once again he swam with everything he had against the current, once again he just barely avoided passing the mouth as Karen stopped drinking, and once again Karen would pick up the glass a few minutes later.

Scott grew more and more afraid as the process continued. It was clear by the fourth time it happened that Karen was going to finish the glass. There was less than a third of the glass filled now, and Karen groggily grabbed the glass once more. Deciding to finally finish it off, Karen tilted the glass and took a final long drink.

Scott was exhausted, and at this point he didn't know why he was even trying to survive anymore. When a giant hand wrapped around and picked up the glass one more time Scott knew the end had come. Despite this, some part of Scott kept pushing to live and swam against the current once more. Scott could barely muster the strength to speak at this point much less shout, but reflex demanded he say something. "God... please... Miss. Please let me live..." Scott gasped as his final words as he finally lost the strength to continue swimming. Naturally Scott's words fell on deaf ears as Karen had no way of knowing what was happening, for her all she was doing was drinking a glass of water. Time seemed to slow down as Scott could barely move as the last bit of water with him in it approached the girl's mouth. As Karen tilted the glass even more the current became faster, Scott watching in weary resignation as he rushed towards Karen's mouth. Finally the inevitable happened and Scott passed Karen's lips. No. NO! Scott thought as the water pooled in her mouth. Karen's tongue began moving, pushing the water back, and she swallowed.

GULP.

That was the last thing Scott heard or felt as the swallow sent the water crashing against the back of and down Karen's throat, the force throwing Scott against the throat wall as though he were a shipwreck victim being thrown by a wave against jagged rocks. Scott was killed instantly, but perhaps that was a mercy as his lifeless body would feel nothing as Karen's digestive juices began breaking him down.

"Aw..." Karen sighed in content as she drank the last of the water. Lying back down for the last time that night, Karen absentmindedly licked her lips with a "mmm..." as she turned her head to her side and fell into a deep sleep...
15311114.title: Climbed out of bed.(getting a drink of water)

On second thought, why not take a closer look?

1531112.content:
'Maybe North would've been better,' Scott thought as he traveled down the length of the girl's leg.

It was Hot under the covers, and getting hotter as the girl's body warmed up the covers. Well, it was too late to turn back now, he was right around her thigh by this point. He was surprised at how still she was, not even a muscle twitch.

CRAAABOOMMMMM!!!!

He thought too soon as she jumped in her bed from the sound of a rather loud Thunder clap. It had been so unexpected that Scott had no time to ready himself. He tumbled off the girl's thigh to the bed below. Fortunately he was uninjured, just a little shook up. Well, he wasn't going to climb back up so he continued on walking along the side of the leg.

CRAAABOOMMMMM!!!!

The leg didn't twitch as badly. She'd been prepared for it this time.

It took Scott about seven or eight minutes more of walking to reach his destination, he smelled it before that. It wasn't horrendous but it was noticeable. The Light from his flashlight slowly illuminated the extremity, A monolith of flesh that towered upward. Walking around the Heel, he slowly shined the flashlight beam up the length of the sole. He'd never admit it to anyone but he had a thing for feet, why he had no idea. She was much too young of course, but she had a cute foot. In a few years ,and providing she avoided foot wear that would mess them up, they would look amazing. The flesh looked soft with no callous. He traced every wrinkle as he pointed the flashlight upward to the toes. They wiggled nervously. Yeah, they would look really amazing. He wondered if she'd gotten the genetics from her mother. Did she have an older sister?

He wanted to find out.
1531112.title: Traveling South

choices: She saw the light in the carpit
She's getting a glass of water or something
15311121.content:
Sure, he could've stayed all night admireing those soles but he decided not to in favor of something a little more mature. So he gave the foot one last glance and made his way off the bed.

Climbing down from a bed that size was a lot more nerve racking than he thought it would be. If it hadn't been from the blankets touching the floor the task would've been impossible for Scott. It almost was. More than once he had been close to falling to his death, it was only though pure luck that he'd made it to the floor. Upon reaching the floor he rested for about fifteen minutes before continuing his journey.

In retrospect, Scott should've shut off his flashlight. The Lightning flashes would have lite his way well enough, but he decided to leave his flashlight on anyway.

Walking through carpet fibers almost up to your chin required more time than he would've liked, but was unavoidable. As he made his way to the bedroom door, He heard a loud THUD. Something that wasn't thunder. He slowly glanced over his shoulder, the young giantess was not in bed but standing in his direction.

What was she going to do?
15311121.title: Looking  for Mother

Try your luck
Something catches Scott's eye
Karen rolls over on her side
15311122.content:
Scotty knew he couldn't stay for very long under the covers. It was warm, and getting warmer, making it harder to breath. But before he left, he wanted to take a closer look at the preteen's foot. Nobody had ever had the opportunity given to him by fate and nobody had ever had the opportunity to view the human anatomy this way. That didn't mean he was going to dive in, he was curious but not stupid.

CRAAABOOMMMMM!!!!

He inched towards the girl's right heel. He could feel the heat radiating outward as he got closer. When he was close enough to touch he shown his light upward once more to view the still wiggling toes, then turned his attention to the heel. He slowly extended his hand, deciding a careful touch over running his fingers across her skin. He didn't want her to kick him. The skin had a texture he'd not felt before, he could move the individual dermal ridges with his fingers, he could almost slip his fingers between them.

CRACKOOOM!!

The Foot flinched, Scotty Jumped back expecting the covers to be thrown off. Nothing happened, he started breathing again.
15311122.title: Touching the Heel of a Giant
